paper_metadata.title: Social assistance influences effects of flooding on household consumption and adult diets in southern Bangladesh

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: TMRI provided monthly cash or food transfers, with or without nutrition behavior change communication (BCC)

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: We assess whether a social assistance program influenced the effects of prior monsoon flooding on household consumption and adult diets in southern Bangladesh | Our findings suggest that, without TMRI, a one-standard-deviation increase in lagged flooding led to households smoothing consumption by drawing down savings and reducing diet quality among both men and women
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: TMRI provided monthly cash or food transfers, with or without nutrition behavior change communication (BCC), following a randomized control trial design in two regions of rural Bangladesh

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: We study the Transfer Modality Research Initiative (TMRI), implemented by the World Food Programme between 2012-2014
evidence_citations.country_citation: TMRI provided monthly cash or food transfers, with or without nutrition behavior change communication (BCC), following a randomized control trial design in two regions of rural Bangladesh, including the coastal south
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: We assess whether a social assistance program influenced the effects of prior monsoon flooding on household consumption and adult diets in southern Bangladesh
